body: Is there an actual failure or is it just not proxied?
It's not proxied (lack of functionality in ZAP).

rename.from: Websocket fails when outgoing proxy is set
rename.to: Websocket not proxied when outgoing proxy is set

issue.title: Proxy WebSocket traffic through outgoing proxy set

repository.name: zaproxy
repository.description: The ZAP by Checkmarx Core project

issue.body:
Change class HttpSender to also use the custom connection manager (one
that does not close the connection and exposes its socket) when sending
requests that have a connection upgrade header (e.g. WebSocket) through
an outgoing proxy.
Change HttpMethodDirector to establish a tunnel if the request has a
connection upgrade header.
Fork HttpConnection to allow to establish a tunnel when requested by
calling code (in this case when the request has a connection upgrade).

Fix #2463 - Websocket not proxied when outgoing proxy is set

body: I'm seeing this issue with most of the online websocket testing sites. Running off of develop. Basically the websocket will open and then disconnect shortly afterwards. I think zap is closing the connection prematurely
Could you provide the URL of one of those sites? It's working fine here with `https://www.websocket.org/echo.html`. Using two ZAP instances one proxying through the other.

https://www.websocket.org/echo.html 
https://libwebsockets.org/testserver/
https://websocketstest.com/

I had to increase the default connection timeout setting, which was 5 seconds. At 5 seconds, the browser would connect successfully however the proxy would drop the socket at the timeout threshold. Even with a larger value, it will still eventually timeout though. Websockets can be open hours or days even.
Which proxy are you referring to? ZAP or the outgoing? Are you able to see any WebSocket traffic in ZAP?

My setup is browser > ZAP > internet

I see the http upgrade message, but there doesn't appear to be a ui to look at the individual frames (unless i'm missing it). With the default setting, the socket channels were being closed by ZAP too early and not at the request of the client or server which is wrong

Ah, I thought you were using browser > ZAP > other proxy > Internet (this issue is about this setup).
OK, that behaviour might be explained by missing WebSocket add-on, if you don't have a WebSocket tab it means it's not installed (you can install it through the marketplace as with main versions).
@thc202 you're awesome, thanks! Do you by chance know if there's a way to programmatically get a callback when the websocket frames are captured?
You need to add a `WebSocketObserver` into the `ExtensionWebSocket` (or to a specific `WebSocketProxy`, if not interested in all).
This thread has been automatically locked since there has not been any recent activity after it was closed. Please open a new issue for related bugs.
